name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.A
descipton: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.B
descipton: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.C
descipton: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.D
descipton: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.E
descipton: Establish and maintain a formal style.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.F
descipton: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.4
descipton: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.5
descipton: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 6 here.)

name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.10
descipton: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
